name: blender
content:
blender noun [C]
(MACHINE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
(UK also liquidizer) an electric machine used in the kitchen for breaking down foods or making smooth liquid substances from soft foods and liquids: Put the roasted pumpkin into a blender with a cup of coconut milk.
mammamaart/Vetta/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesTo make the dressing, pulse the oil, vinegar, mustard and herbs in a blender.Blend the soup in a blender until you have a smooth texture.Whizz the berries, honey and lemon juice together in a blender with some ice.I didn't have a blender so I just mashed it with a fork.

blender noun [C]
(CREATOR)
a person or company that blends (= combines) different ingredients or types of something to make a product such as wine, tea, or perfume: Dom Perignon was a monk from Champagne who gained fame as a master blender. The firm is a blender and importer of tea.
someone who combines different things or styles: She is known as a blender of country music and jazz.
More examplesFewer examplesPerfume blenders take flowers from several successive years to combine them into a blend that smoothes out the variations between the seasons.The blender will make up a trial blend, say 60 c.c. of one wine, 25 c.c. of another, and 80 c.c. of another. He has been in the whisky trade for 40 years, working for 12 years as a blender for Chivas Regal.
